title: Our Lady of Guadalupe Novena
description: Our Lady appeared in the year 1531 to Juan Diego, a simple peasant of Aztec descent who had converted to Catholicism.

days.prayer:
In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

Remember, O most gracious Virgin of Guadalupe, that in your heavenly apparitions on the mount of Tepeyac, you promised to show your compassion and pity toward all who, loving and trusting you, seek your help and call upon you in their necessities and afflictions. You promised to hear our supplications, to dry our tears, and to give us consolation and relief. Never has it been known that anyone who fled to your protection, implored your help, or sought your intercession, was left unaided. Inspired by this confidence, we fly to you, O Mary, ever-Virgin Mother of the true God! Though grieving under the weight of our sins, we come to prostrate ourselves before you. We fully trust that, standing beneath your shadow and protection, nothing will trouble or afflict us, nor do we need to fear illness or misfortune, or any other sorrow. O Virgin of Guadalupe, you want to remain with us through your admirable Image, you who are our Mother, our health, and our life. Placing ourselves beneath your maternal gaze, and having recourse to you in all our necessities, we need do nothing more. O Holy Mother of God, despise not our petitions, but in your mercy hear and answer us. Amen (mention request here‚Ä¶)

O Mary, conceived without sin, I come to your throne of grace to share the fervent devotion of your faithful children who call to you under the glorious title of Guadalupe. Obtain for me a lively faith to do your Son‚Äôs holy will always: May His will be done on earth as it is in heaven.

Our Father Hail Mary Glory Be

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

O Holy Mother of God, despise not our petitions, but in your mercy hear and answer us. Amen (mention request here‚Ä¶)

Dearest Mother of Guadalupe, I beg you for a fortified will to imitate your divine Son‚Äôs charity, to always seek the good of others in need. Grant me this, I humbly ask of you.

Our Father Hail Mary Glory Be

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

Placing ourselves beneath your maternal gaze, and having recourse to you in all our necessities, we need do nothing more. O Holy Mother of God, despise not our petitions, but in your mercy hear and answer us. Amen (mention request here‚Ä¶)

Mary, Mother of vocations, multiply priestly vocations and fill the earth with religious houses which will be light and warmth for the world, safety in stormy nights. Beg your Son to send us many priests and religious. This we ask of you, O Mother.

Our Father Hail Mary Glory Be

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

With my heart full of the most sincere veneration, I prostrate myself before you, O Mother, to ask you to obtain for me the grace to fulfill the duties of my state in life with faithfulness and constancy.

Our Father Hail Mary Glory Be

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

Remember, O most gracious Virgin of Guadalupe, that in your heavenly apparitions on the mount of Tepeyac, you promised to show your compassion and pity toward all who, loving and trusting you, seek your help and call upon you in their necessities and afflictions. You promised to hear our supplications, to dry our tears, and to give us consolation and relief. Never has it been known that anyone who fled to your protection, implored your help, or sought your intercession, was left unaided. Inspired by this confidence, we fly to you, O Mary, ever-Virgin Mother of the true God! Though grieving under the weight of our sins, we come to prostrate ourselves before you. We fully trust that, standing beneath your shadow and protection, nothing will trouble or afflict us, nor do we need to fear illness or misfortune, or any other sorrow. O Virgin of Guadalupe, you want to remain with us through your admirable Image, you who are our Mother, our health, and our life. Placing ourselves beneath your maternal gaze, and having recourse to you in all our necessities, we need do nothing more. O Holy Mother of God, despise not our petitions, but in your mercy hear and answer us. Amen (mention request here‚Ä¶)

O God, You have been pleased to bestow upon us unceasing favors by having placed us under the special protection of the Most Blessed Virgin Mary. Grant us, your humble servants, who rejoice in honoring her today upon earth, the happiness of seeing her face to face in heaven.

Our Father Hail Mary Glory Be

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

Answered Prayers From This Novena

I prayed the novena to Our Lady of Guadalupe when my husband and I are were undergoing fertility treatment. The greatest hope in my life was to become a mother and our treatment was taking place at the time of Our Lady‚Äôs feast day. I became pregnant with my beautiful twins and I am grateful to Our Lady every day that she brought these wonderful children into my life. I have just finished praying the novena now for a friend who wishes to have a child. I have faith that Our Lady, the greatest mother, has a very special love for mothers.

from C.G.

An unplanned prayer was answered that I be devoted to God. Does that make any any sense ? I‚Äôm not to be a nun , but be devoted to God. Waiting to hear either from St. Chaibel or him what that entails.

from K.F.

On December 3rd, I began the novena to our Lady of Guadalupe. On December 5th, I went to my scheduled mammogram, thyroid test, bone density test, & blood work. I am in remission from breast cancer since 2011, thanks to God. Because of my past cancer, I always get very nervous & stressed when going for tests or waiting on results.

However, on December 10th, I received a call from my doctor with my test results. Good news‚Ä¶all my test results were negative and/or normal! Thank you God and Thank you Blessed Mother!!

from M.H.

I applied for an international visa even when I don‚Äôt have prior travel histories to visit my boyfriend there. This international visa is known to be very strict especially coming from a third world country. I prayed this novena, because I really want to spend my Christmas with him. On the 7th day of novena, my visa was released and was approved. Thank you Lady of Guadalupe for granting my Christmas prayer of spending my Christmas with my loved one.

from S.M.

I have a scheduled work training in a different county on October but the embassy of the country has been taking too long in the approval process of my work permit. At the end of my novena, I received an email that it was finally approved.

Thank you to the intercession of Our Lady of Guadalupe. I am forever grateful for Her.

from S.M.

I‚Äôm on a fixed income and I needed an equity loan to build a granny flat and have my son his family live in the main house. My son was going to be co-borrower. My lender had many requirements to go through and it would have taken months if approved. I started the novena and within 2 days we found another lender that didn‚Äôt require a lot history. On the eight day of the novena, we went in to apply for the equity loan and by that evening they told everything was good to go. Praise God for His mother‚Äôs intercession. Our blessed mother came through for us.

from L.N.

I have been doing Novena to our Lady of Guadalupe for a long time now.

I do it from the tenth to the eighteenth of every month even though l know the Feast day is Dec 12th.

This Sunday the 10th was my first day and my friend Sandra presented me with nothing else but a beautiful icon of our Lady of Guadalupe. Blessed Mother has been very helpful and kind to me.

Our Lady of Guadalupe has given me more jobs l can handle. Whenever am in need of a job or to leave another job and go to a new one, I just go to our Lady of Guadalupe.

Are you looking for a new job, please go to Mama Mary of Guadalupe. She is a mother and understands like a very good and compassionate mother. She has helped me in raising my five wonderful children. She has also helped in granting me the pleasure of being a grandmother.

Today is the Feast of our Mother of Sorrows. May she wipe away every sorrow in our lives.

If you are reading this just believe that she will send all your requests to her son Jesus. Mother Mary is very kind.

from G.S.

Our granddaughter was due to have her baby on July 8th.

I prayed the Novena of our Lady of Guadalupe for a safe and blessed delivery.

She had a beautiful baby boy this morning, July 1st, which was the last day of the Novena!

from K.O.

We have been trying to sell our house for several months.

So we started a novena to Saint Joseph and received an offer at the third day of Saint Joseph Novena. Thanks St Joseph!

However the buyer wasn‚Äôt sure and negotiated on the findings with the possibility of backing out.

I started the novena of Our Lady of Guadalupe myself for the first time while the negotiations continued.

On the eight day of the Novena, the buyer agreed with the compensation and continued to move forward with the purchase.

Thanks to the intercession of Our Lady of Guadalupe. I am grateful for her love.

Our Lady of Guadalupe worked another miracle in answer to my fervent and pleading novena to her.

My two year old grandson was suspected by a team of doctors to be Autistic.

This came as a big shock and they did a brain scan.

My prayers to Our Lady for a miracle were answered by her: nothing was shown in his scan. He was reported as a perfectly normal kid.

Praise our Lady of Guadalupe for keeping her promise to wipe away all tears.

Our family is still in shock at her miracle.

Praise the Lord Jesus Christ.

Our Lady of Fatima Novena

More About Our Lady of Guadalupe

Our Lady appeared in the year 1531 to Juan Diego, a simple peasant of Aztec descent who had converted to Catholicism.

She told him to have the bishop build a church on the hill where she appeared, and Juan Diego dutifully told the bishop, but he was not believed at first; instead, a miraculous sign was demanded to prove it was Our Lady.

Our Lady worked the miraculous sign by having roses grow on this hill in the winter, then arranged the roses in Juan Diego‚Äôs tilma (a long tunic), and when Juan Diego showed the bishop by letting the roses fall to the ground, not only did the roses themselves demonstrate the authenticity of the appearance but even more so the fact that the roses had miraculously blazed an image of Our Lady of Guadalupe on his tilma.

The bishop believed him at once and a church was built on the hill. The mass conversion of the Aztec people by the millions followed.

The tilma remains intact to this day, almost five hundred years later, another testament to the miraculous nature of it, as the fiber should have decomposed long ago. Juan Diego was later canonized as well as a testament to his holiness.
